item.title: Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom - Why You Should Start Over in 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • Tears of the Kingdom offers immense content and opens up new strategies in 2025 for players.
  • Restarting the game or rediscovering it prompts unique experiences given its flexible gameplay.
  • Fan-made creations and unique player experiences add novelty and depth to the game.

It has now been nearly two years since the release of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom , and while another installment in the series, Echoes of Wisdom , has launched since then, its legacy is far from over. Tears of the Kingdom built on the groundwork laid by its predecessor to offer players something unprecedented in the Zelda landscape — namely, an expanded emphasis on open-ended gameplay and creativity.

With Tears of the Kingdom being almost two years old now and Echoes of Wisdom , a newer Zelda game, now being available, it might not feel worth replaying in 2025. On the contrary, there are plenty of reasons players should consider restarting Tears of the Kingdom in 2025, with its massive amount of content, emphasis on creative problem-solving, and growing library of fan-made creations all being some of the most notable excuses.

Why Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Is Worth Restarting in 2025

There's Always Something to Do in Tears of the Kingdom

With how much there is to do in Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom , chances are, most players haven't completed it all. In fact, Tears of the Kingdom has even more content than its predecessor, Breath of the Wild , with two entirely new landscapes to explore and scour in the Sky Islands and the Depths. As such, should players find themselves itching to play Tears of the Kingdom again in 2025, they might even benefit from starting over. That way, they can apply a fresh approach to their gameplay and complete things they might not have finished in their first playthrough, all while experiencing the story again alongside it.

Tears of the Kingdom built on the groundwork laid by its predecessor to offer players something unprecedented in the Zelda landscape — namely, an expanded emphasis on open-ended gameplay and creativity.

Even if players don't completely restart Tears of the Kingdom in 2025, simply picking it up again after not playing it for an extended period can feel like starting over. Fortunately, Tears of the Kingdom 's unrestricted gameplay approach means players can essentially do whatever they want, so they should never feel lost or pressured to do one thing or another.

Tears of the Kingdom's Emphasis on Creative Problem-Solving Makes Every Situation Unique

Tears of the Kingdom 's emphasis on creative problem-solving is another reason players should start it over again in 2025, as they can approach almost every situation differently than they might have before. Much of this is due to Tears of the Kingdom 's Ultrahand ability, which allows players nearly unlimited power to create vehicles and structures that can help them overcome obstacles and achieve success. Since there are countless ways players can solve problems in Tears of the Kingdom , this ultimately makes every playthrough feel unique, even if the bulk of the core content remains the same.

Fan-Made Creations Might Inspire New Ideas

Speaking of Ultrahand, the Tears of the Kingdom community has been hard at work over the last couple of years building unique creations and then sharing them online. Many of these have infiltrated the spaces of other players, with community Ultrahand creations in Tears of the Kingdom becoming almost essential to the progression of some other players. From vehicles that are as sustainable as they are effective, to giant monstrosities that can take down Tears of the Kingdom 's most powerful foes, there is seemingly no end to what fans have created in the game. In light of that, those who might have stepped away from Tears of the Kingdom for some time might enjoy experimenting with fan-made creations in their own playthrough.

Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom remains as compelling as ever, not just because of its vast world or innovative mechanics, but because of the limitless ways players can engage with it. Whether revisiting Tears of the Kingdom 's Hyrule to explore unfinished content, experimenting with new approaches, or diving into the ever-evolving landscape of community creations, the game continues to offer a fresh experience even almost two years after its launch. In 2025, Tears of the Kingdom offers more than enough reasons to pick it up again.

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games That Let You Build And Manage Settlements, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Players enjoy building settlements in open-world games for resource acquisition and creating safe spaces.
  • Settlement-building mechanics add engagement in open-world games, offering a break from the main story.
  • Settlement construction, like in Starfield and No Man's Sky , provides fun side activities for players to enjoy and invest in.

Players love the act of investing time in building outposts, settlements, cities , and other such structures. It gives them a reason to acquire valuable resources and use them to create a safe space for themselves and others in a game world.

Some settlement-building mechanics become all the more engaging when implemented in an open world . Along with the amazing journeys players can experience in these games, they can always take a breather and focus on a different gameplay pillar altogether to keep them engaged.

Games will be ranked based on the depth and engagement derived from their settlement-building mechanics.

8 Starfield

Outposts Are Fun To Create And Populate

Fans of Fallout 4 's settlement building may find Starfield a bit lacking in this regard. However, constructing outposts is still fun and gives players more agency in deciding when and how their home base is populated.

It may seem like an afterthought, but players who want to flex their creative muscles can create some amazing outposts in Starfield . It's just one of the many ways players can keep themselves busy in the vast world of Starfield , making it well worth a second look despite its middling reception.

7 No Man's Sky

Players Construct A Bunch Of Buildings To Spruce Up Their Settlement

Given the sheer amount of content that has been added to No Man's Sky since its release, it isn't all that surprising that fans are able to create settlements on planets as well.

While every settlement can look the same after players construct every building possible, that takes nothing away from this fun base-building mechanic that will keep them occupied for hours. It's just one of the many ways No Man's Sky captures a player's attention and amazes them with the wealth of meaningful content present in this title.

6 Kingdom Come: Deliverance

The From The Ashes DLC Lets Players Restore And Improve Pribyslavitz

Given the humble peasant origins of Henry, the protagonist of Kingdom Come: Deliverance, players were amazed to see the heights he reached after his hometown was razed to the ground. This son of a blacksmith becomes a competent warrior and can even play a direct role in helping the village of Pribyslavitz regain its former glory.

Players who love creating and helping settlements prosper in their open-world games will find the content of the From the Ashes DLC to be a perfect fit for them. Given the absurd amount of gold players can amass during their adventures, Pribyslavitz is a great place to invest these funds and help this village prosper after the hard times it has endured.

5 The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild

Players Will Love Investing In Tarrey Town's Development

Breath of the Wild is one of the greatest open-world video games ever made, and it is full to the brim with unique secrets. This includes a sidequest to help a town prosper after Link buys a house in Hateno Village.

The constructors finish this work and head to a clearing that serves as the foundation for Tarrey Town. Link is encouraged to give Hudson the wood he gathers around the world, and find potential employees across Hyrule who can help this town prosper. Clearly, the hero succeeds, given how this town is flourishing in Tears of the Kingdom .

4 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Geralt Gains Ownership Of The Corvo Bianco Vineyard In The Blood & Wine DLC

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt's Blood & Wine DLC is one of the greatest expansion packs in video game history, and fans can't get enough of it. The region of Beauclair is beautiful and full to the brim with a wealth of side content for players to complete.

One of these optional activities opens up once Geralt gets the deed to the Corvo Bianco estate. He can invest his money into improving the estate and making it a beautiful piece of land, adorning it with the many paintings and weapons that the Witcher acquires during his travels.

3 Fallout 4

Settlement Building Is A Huge Part Of The Game

Fans have warmed to Fallout 4 as the years have gone by, with the game's amazing open-world design being appreciated by many. Another gameplay pillar that fans had a great time with was settlement building, a new and welcome inclusion to the Fallout series.

While players can ignore this side of the game altogether, they are encouraged to find supplies and deck out the many run-down areas they liberate from monsters, bandits, or other enemy groups. Some people get invested in this area of the game in no time, which is perfect if they want to side with the Minutemen at the end of Fallout 4 .

2 Medieval Dynasty

Players Help Create And Maintain A Thriving Medieval Settlement

Players who want to check out a survival and crafting game set in Medieval times will have a great time with Medieval Dynasty . Players start with nothing and must struggle for food and resources as they establish a settlement.

As their village becomes larger and more populated, players get more toys to mess around with as their options increase. This gradual progress is handled with great care and ensures that players will love how satisfying it feels to manage a thriving settlement that they built from scratch.

1 Kenshi

An Open-World Game With Immense Freedom Where Settlement Building Is Just One Of Many Distractions

Kenshi is one of the best open-world games around for players who want to enjoy freeform gameplay with no limits. Players are unceremoniously dropped into a sandbox with little to nothing to their name and must grind out basic stats before they can even think about exploring the hostile world.

As players build up the confidence they need, they will eventually figure out how to build a settlement in an unclaimed area and help it thrive. It can be wildly absorbing, as players can construct the base of their dreams and save it from the many hostiles that threaten to tear their settlement down.

item.title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance - Console Commands
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Console Commands in Kingdom Come: Deliverance
    • How to Enable Developer Mode in Kingdom Come: Deliverance
    • All Kingdom Come: Deliverance Cheat Commands
  • The Kingdom Come: Deliverance Cheat Mod

Kingdom Come: Deliverance is a cult classic, open-world game in an epic medieval setting. The game can be highly challenging, especially when playing in hardcore mode. Thankfully, console commands exist that can make your gameplay easier or can help shake things up during a second or third playthrough.

In addition, some console commands can help you adjust settings to improve your PC's performance and visuals. However, there are a few things you should know before using them. In this guide, we'll show you how to use all console commands in Kingdom Come: Deliverance so you can have the perfect playing experience tailored to you.

Updated on March 7, 2025, by Mark Sammut: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 has been out for more than a month, and the sequel has proven to be a great success by any metric, not just in comparison to its predecessor. While most people are likely occupied with the 2025 title, some newcomers might be interested in trying out the original release so they can experience Henry's story in full. As Kingdom Come: Deliverance is considerably harder than its successor, the console commands can make things considerably easier and more accessible, especially for players who primarily want to focus on the story. This guide has been expanded with a few more tips, including a popular mod that builds upon the vanilla console commands.

All Console Commands in Kingdom Come: Deliverance

There are several essential things to remember when using console commands in Kingdom Come: Deliverance . First, you need to enable developer mode. Second, you need to assign the commands to hotkeys. Finally, it's essential to understand how each command works.

How to Enable Developer Mode in Kingdom Come: Deliverance

Before using the Kingdom Come: Deliverance console commands below, you must enable developer mode by entering a specific setting into the Steam game's launch options.

Here's how to enable developer mode in Kingdom Come: Deliverance :

  1. Navigate to the game in your Steam Library
  2. Right-click and select the Properties option
  3. Click on the Launch Options button
  4. Type in "-devmode" into the text field (without the quotation marks)

All Kingdom Come: Deliverance Cheat Commands

You can now open the console by pressing the "~" (Tilde) key when in-game. For any of the Kingdom Come: Deliverance console commands with the "#" symbol, you must either enter 0 to disable or 1 to enable the command. In addition, you must provide a specific amount of an item you want to add for commands that give you something.

Tilde can be a somewhat difficult key to find, depending on the user's location and PC. In the case of U.S. keyboards, the option is generally quite easy as "~" is written on the keyboard, with the key being right under the ESC button. Simply press Shift + that key to activate Kingdom Come: Deliverance 's console command interface. For non-U.S. keyboards, Tilde might not be written on their peripherals, which can make things harder. However, selecting Shift + the key under ESC could still work, even if Tilde is not actively written on it.

Console Command

Console Command Information

cheat_add_all_perks

You now have all the perks in the game

cheat_add_buff_immortal

You are now immortal

cheat_add_buff_invisible

You are now invisible

cheat_no_lockpicking

Automatically unlocks all doors and turns off the lockpicking minigame

cheat_set_wanted_level=0

Removes your wanted level

cheat_wash_dirt_and_blood

Cleans you of all dirt and blood

cl_fov #

Changes your FOV (60 is the default value)

e_MergedMeshesInstanceDist #

Changes plant draw distance (20 is the default value)

e_TimeOfDay

This shows the time of day or night

e_ViewDistRatio #

Changes the draw distance (500 is the default value)

e_ViewDistRatioVegetation #

Changes tree draw distance (500 is the default value)

g_godmode #

Command for God Mode. 0 disables, and 1 enables

g_showHUD #

The command for the HUD. 0 disables, and 1 enables

p_gravity_z #

Changes the gravity of the game (-13 is the default value)

q

Quits the desktop without saving

r_antialiasing mode #

The default value is 0, 1 is SMAA 1x, 2 is SMAA 1TX, 3 is SMAA 3x

r_Motion Blur #

0 disables, 1 enables camera blur, and 2 enables object blur

r_vysnc #

Command for Vsync. 0 disables, and 1 enables it.

t_scale #

Changes the model scale (1 is the default value)

wh_cheat_additem (Item ID) #

Provides you with a specified amount of a specific item based on the Item ID you enter

wh_cheat_money #

Provides you with a specific amount of Groschen

wh_dlg_chatbubbles #

The command for changing character subtitles as you are exploring towns. 0 disables and 1 enables.

wh_pl_showfirecursor #

The command for the Bow weapon Crosshair. 0 disables, and 1 enables

wh_horse_CameraCentering #

Change speed of centering on horse. 0.2 is the default value, and 0 disables centering altogether

wh_ui_ShowCompass #

The command for the compass. 0 disables, and 1 enables. However, the game resets this command after you open any menu screen.

wh_ui_ShowCursor #

The command for the cursor icon. 0 disables, and 1 enables. However, the game resets this command after you open any menu screen.

wh_ui_ShowStats #

The command for Stats: 0 disables, and 1 enables. However, the game resets this command after you open any menu screen.

The Kingdom Come: Deliverance Cheat Mod

The default Kingdom Come: Deliverance console commands cover a wide range of options, but they are still relatively limited in the grand scheme of things. Consequently, players who want more options to tweak a playthrough might wish to look into the mod scene to see if any downloads would expand the console commands options.

Othiden's Cheat mod serves as a great starting point as it significantly expands the commands, introducing changes like unlimited quicksave, money manipulation, stat tweaks, and a lot more. Anybody new to the modding scene should make sure to read the instructions provided on Nexusmods.

item.title: Roblox: Infinite Script Fighting Codes (March 2025)
item.description:
Infinite Script Fighting is an unusual Battleground game where, instead of using the usual abilities, you will use scripts to fight your opponents. There are very few similar Roblox experiences, which makes Infinite Script Fighting almost unique in this concept.

In this game, scripts play the role of superpowers, but they are many times stronger and more unpredictable. By redeeming Infinite Script Fighting codes, you can get even more scripts and choose the one that suits you best.

Updated March 7, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Using codes is an easy way to grab extra in-game perks. They don’t last forever, so claiming them quickly is always a good idea. Stay updated, as fresh codes tend to drop with major updates.

All Infinite Script Fighting Codes

Working Infinite Script Fighting Codes

  • CYB3R - Redeem this code to get Cyber Monarch Script. (NEW)
  • ISF2024 - Redeem this code to get Dubstep Gun.
  • 2MVISITS - Redeem this code to get +100 Kills.
  • ISFBANHAMMER - Redeem this code to get Banhammer.

Expired Infinite Script Fighting Codes

There are currently no expired Infinite Script Fighting codes, so redeem active ones as soon as possible to avoid missing out on rewards.

Redeeming codes from Infinite Script Fighting is really important because it will give you a significant advantage over those who have not done so. The rewards from the codes will be not only unique scripts that you can't get anywhere else, but also a bunch of other useful things that will come in handy, so don't neglect them.

How to Redeem Codes for Infinite Script Fighting

Since Infinite Script Fighting 's redemption system is quite common in other Roblox games, experienced players shouldn't have any problems with getting rewards. Still, if you are a beginner and don't understand how it works, here is a detailed guide:

  • Launch Infinite Script Fighting .
  • Pay attention to the lower-left corner of the screen. There will be a bunch of buttons arranged in a column. Among them, interact with the one that says Codes.
  • This will open the redemption menu. There will be an input field and a black Redeem button below it. Now, enter manually, or better yet, copy and paste one of the above-mentioned active codes into the input field.
  • Lastly, click on the black Redeem button to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see “ Successfully redeemed code ” below the input field and the rewards will be credited to your account.

How to Get More Infinite Script Fighting Codes

To get more Infinite Script Fighting Codes codes, be prepared to spend a little time, as it requires careful monitoring of the game's official social media. We have collected all of them below, so just visit each of them and check the latest posts for Roblox codes.

  • Official Infinite Script Fighting Roblox group.
  • Official Infinite Script Fighting Discord server.
